item.title: What _is_ computational creativity, anyway?
item.description: Computational creativity is what happens when we try to use the machine as a creative partner, a shattered prism, a performance enhancing drug. It’s a wonderful partnership between the machine, art, and humanistic understanding of the past. One of the best examples I can think of right now is Ferraby and St. John’s Soundmarks ‘using sound and visual art to explore and animate the sub-surface landscape of Aldborough Roman Town in North Yorkshire, UK’.
